Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 3: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease (Including Immunizations)

Written Policy Re: Exclusion Licensed Child Care Centers

It is a licensing requirement for child care centers (Rule R400.8155) and a recommendation for licensed family and group child care homes and license exempt child care homes to develop a written policy on exclusion. Select each flashcard to read more about developing a written policy on exclusion.

Must Be Developed, Written, And Implemented

It is a newly added requirement that the plan is written.

Details On Exclusion For Children, Staff & Volunteers

It must include details on exclusion for children, staff, and volunteers. Having a specific plan for exclusion will allow the center to be consistent in their approach and decrease disagreements between parents and staff.

Plan For Notifying Parents

There needs to be a consistent plan that is shared with the parents at enrollment that explains how they will be notified if their child becomes too ill and needs to be sent home.

Provide Separate Area For Sick Children

While the center is waiting for the parents to pick up the child, they are to be kept in a separate area where they are cared for and supervised.

Items Used By Sick Child To Be Washed & Sanitized

Any item or facility used by the sick child or adult needs to be washed, rinsed, and sanitized before being used by others.
